Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.name: recursivePresent(_:animated:completion:)
Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.abstract: Presents a UIViewController (B) modally from self, even if self is already presenting another ViewController (A). In that case, A will be asked to present B.

Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.name: softDismiss(animated:completion:)
Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.abstract: Dismiss self but keeps all the presented ViewControllers in the hierarchy.

Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.name: toBeDismissed
Extensions/UIViewController.html#/s:So16.abstract: Used in the implementation of the UIKit method: UIViewController.softDismiss(animated:completion:).

Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.name: soft
Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.abstract: If the targeted modal is presenting other modals, keep them alive.

Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.name: hard
Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.abstract: While removing the targeted modal, remove also all the modals that it is presenting.

Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.name: ModalDismissBehaviour
Enums/NavigationInstruction/ModalDismiss.abstract: Define one of the two possible behaviours when dismissing a modal ViewController:

Classes/ViewControllerWithLocalState.htm.name: lastKnownState
Classes/ViewControllerWithLocalState.htm.abstract: This is the last value for global state we observed, we are saving this to be able to update the ViewModelWithLocalState

Classes/ViewControllerWithLocalState.htm.name: willUnsubscribe()
Classes/ViewControllerWithLocalState.htm.abstract: Called just before the unsubscribe, override point for subclasses.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: connected
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: true if the ViewController is connected to the store, false otherwise.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: store
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: The store the ViewController will use to receive state updates.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: state
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: The state of this ViewController

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: shouldDisconnectOnViewWillDisappear
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Whether the view controller should disconnect itself from the store updates on viewWillDisappear.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: shouldConnectWhenVisible
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: When true, the ViewController will be set to connected = true as soon as it becomes visible.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: shouldDisconnectWhenInvisible
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: When true the ViewController will be set to connected = false as soon as it becomes invisible.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: viewModel
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: The latest ViewModel received by this ViewController from the state.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: rootView
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Use the rootView to access the main view managed by this viewController.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: loadView()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Used internally to load the specific main view managed by this view controller.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: init(store:connected:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Returns a newly initialized ViewController object.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: setup()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Override to setup something after init.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: dispatch(action:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Shortcut to the dispatch function.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: dispatch(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Shortcut to the dispatch function.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: init(coder:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Required init.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: The ViewController is about to be displayed.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: viewWillDisappear(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: The ViewController is about to be removed from the view hierarchy.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Called after the controller's view is loaded into memory.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: willUpdate(new:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Called just before the update, override point for subclasses.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: didUpdate(old:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Called right after the update, override point for subclasses.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.name: setupInteraction()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Asks to setup the interaction with the managed view, override point for subclasses.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:7Tempura1.abstract: Called just before the unsubscribe, override point for subclasses.

Classes/ViewController.html.name: ViewController
Classes/ViewController.html.abstract: Manages a screen of your app, it keeps the UI updated and listens for user interactions.
